isis.stitle: EC-30 ABS / ATC CONTROLLER - BLINK CODE DIAGNOSTICS

svcprocinfo.para: The EC-30 provides diagnostic and configuration functions using blink code diagnostics. When the blink code mode is activated, the EC-30 flashes the ABS warning lamp to communicate active fault codes, fault code history or ABS and ATC configurations. The blink code diagnostics mode can also be used to reset active fault codes. See Table 5.

The ABS warning lamp illuminates while the blink code switch is pressed. The lamp turns off when the blink code switch is released. The blink code switch is optional and may not be installed on some vehicles (pin F3 of the 30-pin connector).

Following a single display of all available messages, the ABS warning lamp remains on for five seconds and then returns to the normal operating mode. Fault occurrence count information is not displayed with blink code diagnostics.

If wheel speeds are detected during the blink code diagnostics mode, the EC-30 exits the blink code diagnostics and returns to the normal operating mode. The blink code diagnostics mode can only be activated following a power-up, where wheel speeds have not been detected.

svcsubproc.title: Display Active Fault Codes
svcsubproc.para: To display active fault codes, press the blink code switch one time. Following activation, there will be a three second delay, followed by a blink code display of all active fault codes. See Table 6 for blink code information.

svcsubproc.title: Display Fault Code History
svcsubproc.para: To display history fault codes, press the blink code switch two times. Following activation, there will be a three second delay, followed by a blink code display of all history fault codes. See Table 6.

svcsubproc.title: Reset Active Fault Codes
svcsubproc.para: To reset active fault codes, press the blink code switch three times. Following activation, there will be a three second delay, followed by a blink code message of:
1 -1, (System Fully Operational - No Faults Detected) or A blink code display of all active fault codes.
The ABS warning lamp will stay on if active faults are still present. See Table 6.
Resetting active fault codes with blink code diagnostics does not clear information from the fault history. Fault history can be retrieved by using blink code diagnostics or a diagnostic tool.

entry.para: System Fully Operational - No Faults Detected

Trailer ABS - Warning Lamp Open (Dash Mounted)
Check ABS warning lamp wiring and connections. Verify proper illumination of warning lamp at power-up.
Trailer ABS - Warning Lamp Shorted (Dash Mounted)
J1939 Data Link Retarder Communication Fault
ECU not communicating with vehicle retarder. Check J1939 wiring and connections to ECU. Verify correct retarder control setting in ECU.
J1939 Data Link Engine Communication Fault
ECU not communicating with engine. Check J1939 wiring and connections to ECU. Verify correct engine communications link setting in ECU.
J1922 Data Link Engine Communication Fault
ECU not communicating with engine. Check J1922 wiring and connections to ECU. Verify correct engine communications link setting in ECU.
J1922 Data Link Retarder Communication Fault
ECU not communicating with vehicle retarder. Check J1922 wiring and connections to ECU. Verify correct retarder control setting in ECU.

svcsubproc.title: Display EC-30 Configuration
svcsubproc.para: To check the ECU configuration, press the blink code switch four times. Following activation, there will be a three second delay, followed by a blink code display of the EC-30 configuration. See Table 7.

entry.para: Full ATC (Engine Torque Limiting and Differential Braking)
